alert.note: Alert for Caledonia (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:27PM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Passumpsic River at Passumpsic affecting Caledonia County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passumpsic River at Passumpsic. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying trailer homes near the river will see some minor flooding. At 15.0 feet, Route 5 will flood In St. Johnsbury center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EST Monday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 700 AM EST.
